Case reference: 2014004827.CaseDesc: On July 6, 2004, 41 year old Jacqueline "Jackie" Bob was last seen picking mushrooms in the Brittany Triangle of the Nemiah Valley.

Case reference: 2020011116.CaseDesc: Glen Peddle had been hitchhiking through the United States between 1982 and 1985. In April 1985, Glen called his mother from New York to tell her that he was planning on returning home to Newfoundland in the spring, but never returned home.

Case reference: 2006008399.CaseDesc: Joseph Niro last contacted his daughter by telephone on June 02, 1999. He was last seen on June 20, 1999.

Hair: Black, Long, Wavy, Parted to the right

Case reference: 2013000010.CaseDesc: Jaime Wyatt was reported missing to the St-John's RCMP by family members that he had not been seen since November 12th, 1996. Jaime was a resident of Newfoundland and left the province in September 1996 to seek employment in Nova Scotia. The investigation revealed that Jaime stayed at the Twin Elms Motel on Inglis Street in Halifax, Nova Scotia and he was last seen there on November 16th, 1996. On the evening of November 16th, 1996, Jaime informed the staff at Twin Elms that he was going to be picked up to go to a dinner party that evening.  Jaime was never heard from or seen since that day and foul play is suspected.

Case reference: 2006017699.CaseDesc: Marianne Minor was a resident of the St. Thomas Psychiatric Hospital in 1984. She left her ward to go to the canteen and has never been seen again.

Case reference: 2020006631.CaseDesc: On June 30, 1980, Alan Hood was last seen in Toronto, Ontario. During the time of his disappearance, Alan was despondent.

Case reference: 2014005122.CaseDesc: On May 27, 2008, Phillip Morin was last seen in the Colony Street area of Winnipeg, Manitoba.

Case reference: 2006010199.CaseDesc: Mr. Donald Chorney was last seen leaving the Keys Lake Campground near Grassy Narrows, Ontario to go for a boat ride.  He has never returned and is presumed drowned.

Case reference: 2014005222.CaseDesc: On May 12, 2008, at approximately noon, Syed Zaman was seen for the last time at his home in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2014004085.CaseDesc: On December 27, 1999, Simon Farah was seen for the last time at his residence in the Verdun District in Montreal, Quebec. During the time of his disappearance, Simon was suffering from mental health issues. He has not been seen and has not given any news to his family, which is contrary to his habits.

Case reference: 2014005249.CaseDesc: Peter Cory Butler was reported missing by family on March 24, 2008. He was last seen in downtown Whitecourt, AB on March 15, 2008.

Case reference: 2010003599.CaseDesc: Alexander McAuley was reported missing by family members on April 23, 2010, after not having any contact with him since 2002. Mr. McAuley was known to lead a high risk lifestyle and may have met with foul play.

Case reference: 2014005302.CaseDesc: On November 11, 2005, in Toronto, Canada, Zaina Trujillo-Talib was abducted by her father, Chaudhry Talib and her paternal grandmother, Shama Talib.  Chaudhry and Shama immediately took six-year-old Zaina to their family home located in Lahore, Pakistan.  Since this time, Zaina's mother has not been allowed to have any contact with her daughter.

Case reference: 2005002599.CaseDesc: On October 21, 1989, an unidentified man was discovered in the area of County Road 14 in Napanee, Ontario.  Biogeographic ancestry testing predicts that this man was of south Asian ancestry.

Shirt: White, DRESS, Brand: Pierre Cardin; grey, blue, and red thin stripes

Case reference: 2006004499.CaseDesc: James Pearce was last seen in the Grafton area on October 5, 1999. On October 8, 1999, his 1949 pink Dodge pick-up truck was located at the Cobourg train station parking lot.

Hair: Brown, Straight, Brush Cut, Recent #2 cut at time of disappearance
Scar: Torso (Back), Numerous scars from an accident
Head, A 1 inch scar under hair on left side
Left Leg, Scar from a fracture
Tattoo: Right Hand, Banner with the name Laurie
Left Arm, Skeleton with top hat

Case reference: 2014004923.CaseDesc: On July 24th, 1973, Robert Chaple was reported missing. He was last seen arriving home on July 11th in the early morning hours.

Case reference: 2014003815.CaseDesc: Monica Cardinal was reported missing to the Edmonton Police Service in February, 1997. Monica was last seen leaving a downtown hotel with an unknown male in June, 1993.

Case reference: 2014002912.CaseDesc: On June 29, 1982, Serge Aumont was seen for the last time in the Hochelaga district of Montreal, Quebec. Serge left his mother’s home with a friend to go to a medical clinic. He has not been seen or heard from since.

Foreign Object: Mouth, Upper and lower partial dentures

Case reference: 2014005286.CaseDesc: Karl Behr was last seen on December 25, 1981, in Edmonton, Alberta, when he left a family function to return to his residence. It was noted that Karl's green parka and winter boots were missing from his home. Karl speaks with a slight German accent.

Case reference: 2014005633.CaseDesc: On July 7, 2011, Dillon Mcmaster had been swimming in the Bow River in Alberta with a group of friends. Dillon was caught in a current, pulled under and was not seen again. Multiple efforts to locate Dillon were negative and he is presumed to have drowned.

Case reference: 2018005158.CaseDesc: Darryl Langan was last seen on Highway 10 on January 19th, 2018, walking from Melville to Yorkton, Saskatchewan, in the vicinity of the community of Otthon (between Melville and Yorkton, Saskatchewan).

Case reference: 2012020068.CaseDesc: On January 19, 1996 Winston Redhead's father reported that he had not heard from his son since December 21, 1995.  Winston's brother advised that Winston indicated he would be home for Christmas.  The last contact with Winston was made by staff at the Main Street Project in Winnipeg on December 26, 1995.  He told staff there that he would be going back up north. Winston has not been located and his whereabouts remain unknown.

Case reference: 2014030665.CaseDesc: On January 19, 1978, the partial remains of a female believed to be aged between 55-70 years of age, were found in the waters of the Salish Sea, southwest of Victoria, British Columbia. She had moderate arthritis and significant healed injuries to her left ankle and foot. It is believed she was deceased several months or even years before her remains were recovered

Case reference: 2006009799.CaseDesc: On May 25, 1974, Francis Foster, Robert Warren and another friend departed for a canoe trip on Basswood Lake, Quetico Park, 45 miles (72 km) south of Atikokan, Ontario. It is believed that the canoe overturned and all three are presumed drowned.

Case reference: 2014002728.CaseDesc: On May 25, 1996, at approximately 2:00 p.m., Gary Landry was last seen as he left his residence in Thunder Bay, Ontario, on his dark blue 12 speed Supercycle Mountain bike with black plastic fenders. Gary was prone to having seizures and frequented the north side of Thunder Bay on his bicycle.

Case reference: 2016030649.CaseDesc: Kean Luo was originally from Malaysia, but had moved to the United States to attend school and begin his career. On March 2, 2016 Mr. Luo moved to Winnipeg, Manitoba for work. Friends and family began to worry about Mr. Luo as they were unable to reach him for an extended period of time. However, on April 2, 2016, police spoke with Mr. Luo at a local hotel. Mr. Luo said that he was not feeling suicidal, but was feeling stressed and missing his family. He was last seen on April 2, 2016 on the Sergeant Thomas Cooper bridge with his vehicle parked on the shoulder of the highway. All cell phone and bank activity have ceased.

Case reference: 2014002921.CaseDesc: Alban Robichaud has been missing since May 30, 1991 from Saint John, New Brunswick. Alban was employed with City Laundry and left his place of work at 3pm the day he went missing. Alban was seen in various uptown Saint John pubs and was last seen at Gene's Country Palace between 11:00 & 11:30 pm.

Case reference: 2006026599.CaseDesc: On August 1, 1995, William Reed left his residence and left a note saying he was going fishing. His truck was located parked near Gibson Mill Road, Phelps Township, with the keys and his wallet inside.

Hat: Green, cap with white lettering on the front

Case reference: 2021059908.CaseDesc: On June 16, 2016, the partial remains of an unidentified man were recovered in Renews, Newfoundland. Between 2016 and 2018, additional remains belonging to this man were recovered.

Case reference: 2014004296.CaseDesc: On November 20, 2002, Lowell Flett was reported missing by his employer as he had failed to show up for work for the 5th day. Lowell was last seen by his girlfriend, on November 16th. He left the residence on his ski-doo and has not been seen since. Despite intensive land and water searches neither Lowell nor his ski-doo have been located. He is presumed to have drowned as a result of his sled falling through the ice.

Case reference: 2014003208.CaseDesc: On September 17, 1996, Louie Stalthanee was last seen at approximately 4:00 p.m. on the East side of Fir Island on Black Lake in Saskatchewan. The boat he had been using was found beached on Fir Island. It is suspected that Mr. Stalthanee drowned; however he has never been located.

Case reference: 2014001111.CaseDesc: On February 7th, 1994, the remains of an adult male (25-50 years old), 5'10-6'0 tall, with a thin build, were located by land surveying students in a wooded area near the village of Anmore. The investigation determined the cause of death to be a self-inflicted gunshot wound. A black guitar case was found near the remains. He went missing sometime after May 1992.

Belt: Black, Blue, Fabric belt with a metal Indian Chief Belt buckle inscribed "HARA"
Jacket: Cotton, Blue, Blue with Green Gold piping sleeved Windbreaker Jacket
Pants: Nylon, Blue, Maroon, Sweat pants with zipper on cuffs
Shirt: Cotton, Grey, Black, Long Sleeved Sweatshirt

Case reference: 2019070875.CaseDesc: On April 17, 2019, the remains of a woman were found in a crawl space of a triplex in Montreal, Québec.

Case reference: 2014004393.CaseDesc: Jean Garnek lived in an apartment block in the McGregor area of the city, where she was known to walk wherever she needed to go. She was also known to use the Winnipeg Transit System.

Case reference: 2016055037.CaseDesc: Human remains were found on May 10, 2006 in a field near Mossleigh, AB. They are believed to be those of a female, over the age of 40, possibly of Caucasian or Indigenous descent, who was between 5’2” and 5’6”. The individual was missing teeth and likely wore an upper denture. The individual may have complained of joint pain due to arthritis. The remains appear to have been there from 1 to 5 years.

Fractured/Broken Bones: Right Cheek, Healed fracture of right cheek bone
Mark: Right Side Of Head, Large button osteoma on right side of forehead

Case reference: 2016018567.CaseDesc: Mekayla was last seen at the STC Bus Depot in Yorkton at 1:45 p.m. on April 12, 2016. She went to school in the morning, but left shortly after arriving. She went to several businesses in Yorkton throughout the morning, then returned to school around noon. She bought lunch at the restaurant in the bus depot, but did not get on a bus that day. Mekayla left the bus depot in the early afternoon and hasn't been seen since.

Case reference: 2014004807.CaseDesc: On October 28, 1988, Ronald Gerard Cole went missing. He has not been heard from by family or friends since then. He was a resident of Warren, Ontario.

Case reference: 2021060022.CaseDesc: Erin Brooks had been last seen by her family on December 24th, 2021, and her roommate on December 27th, 2021. Erin was observed later on that particular day at the St-Mary's Smoke Shop in Sitansisk (St-Mary's First Nation), New Brunswick.

Tattoo: Left Forearm, Unknown tattoo in black ink
Back Of Neck, Four black turtles
Right Wrist, Unknown tattoo in black ink
Left Chest, Text "BOO" in blue ink

Case reference: 2014004372.CaseDesc: Patrick-Jean De Loppinot was last seen on September 11, 2003, at a friend's residence in Laval. He was supposed to go home but never arrived. He left with a black 1990 Volkswagen Jetta registered in Québec. At the time of his disappearance, Mr. De Loppinot lived with family in Longueuil. He was reported missing by his family.

Case reference: 2014005776.CaseDesc: James Turgeon was last seen on Wednesday, April 17, 2012 at approximately 3:00 p.m. traveling East on foot on Highway #16 near North Battleford, Saskatchewan. James has known mental health issues and has been diagnosed with schizophrenia. He has a history of walking away from his residence, but will usually return. He has not been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2014003250.CaseDesc: On November 1, 1974, four people left the Whitedog Indian Reserve, Ontario in a 14' Lund boat and were heading for Pointe du Bois, Manitoba. Their intention was to go to Pointe du Bois to pick up supplies and then return to Whitedog. On November 5, 1974, these individuals were reported missing as they had never returned to Whitedog.  It is believed that the boat overturned and everyone drowned. Two bodies were recovered, and the cause of death was determined to be drowning. Searches were conducted by boat and by air but the bodies of Paul Scott and Richard Petawanahqueb were never recovered.  Paul and Richard are presumed dead due to drowning. No foul play is suspected.

Case reference: 2014005364.CaseDesc: Antoinette Neveu was reported missing on January 11, 1991, after failing to arrive at her place of employment in Edmonton, Alberta. She has not been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2014004316.CaseDesc: The last time Trevor Angell was heard from was on the 22nd of September 2000. Trevor is a truck driver who was transporting cargo from Calgary, Alberta to Los Angeles, California.  His truck was located in Primm, Nevada, USA on 25 September 2000.

Case reference: 2014003554.CaseDesc: On May 30, 1986, Edward Ludwig was seen for the last time as he left his work site at the Bow Valley Provincial Park in Canmore, Alberta. At this time, Edward was on his way to go boating on Lake Minnewanka in Banff National Park in Alberta. His boat was found empty floating on the lake. During the time of his disappearance, Edward was despondent.

Case reference: 2023037557.CaseDesc: On July 13, 2023, Travis McDuffie was seen for the last time in Calgary, Alberta.  Reports have been received of possible sightings of Travis at several businesses located in the 3200 to 5100 blocks of 17 Avenue S.E., Calgary, Alberta.

Case reference: 2014006316.CaseDesc: Andrew William Munro was last seen in Stewart, British Columbia on November 15, 2013. Police and family are concerned for his well being as he needs daily medication. He may be clean shaven or have a goatee. Mr. Munro may have been crossing the border between British Columbia and Alaska. Mr. Munro was a long time lower mainland resident who had recently moved to Stewart, to pursue a career in the logging industry.

Hair: Brown, Short, Sometimes has a goatee.

Case reference: 2014005263.CaseDesc: On November 1, 2007, Annie Proulx was seen for the last time in the Rimouski area in Quebec. Annie has not been seen or heard from since.

Tattoo: Right Upper Arm, Rose, Heart and Bulldog

Case reference: 2014004614.CaseDesc: Jacob Miller has gone missing in the past, however he has always returned. Mr. Miller was last seen in Winnipeg, MB going for a walk carrying a green backpack and appearing quite disheveled.

Case reference: 2016061831.CaseDesc: On September 1, 1980, a caucasian male, believed to be between the ages of 50 to 65 years old, was found at the bottom of the fourth floor stairway of the parking garage at 50 Cumberland Avenue in Yorkville, Toronto. He had trauma to his face and skull possibly due to a fall down the stairs. His appendix was present and he was circumcised.

Hair: Brown, Grey, Short, Beard of a couple of days
Teeth: Visible Missing, Many of his teeth were lost some time before death and some of the remaining teeth had cavities. He had no dental work.
Pants: Brown, Blue, Light brown, plaid, Levi's brand
Shirt: Yellow, Long sleeved sport shirt with "Stevenson 114" written on the inside of the collar
Shorts: Light Blue, Dark Blue, Checkered, size 30 from Sears

Case reference: 2021015231.CaseDesc: On December 8, 2017, at approximately 1:06 p.m., James Ryding was seen for the last time as he left his apartment in Niagara Falls, New York. During the time of his disappearance, James may have been despondent.

Coat: Blue, Winter, Possibly wearing a puffy royal blue coat

Case reference: 2019053661.CaseDesc:
On July 2, 1988, an unidentified man was found in the parking lot of the Value Village
on East Hastings Street in Vancouver, British Columbia. The man had suffered from a
heart attack, and the results of his autopsy showed evidence of previous heart damage and a case of mild chronic obstructive pulmonary disease (COPD).

Case reference: 2006003399.CaseDesc: On November 2, 2001, this male, was found in a sewer at 470 Lansdowne Avenue in Toronto. His ancestry is Caucasian, possibly Egyptian or mixed African/Caucasian. He had previous surgery of his left forearm, which had involved the implant of surgical plates. The numbers visible on the surgical plates could not be traced to a specific individual, however, it was determined that the lot was released some time after May 25, 1994. A MacDonald’s name tag with the name "Raymond" was found in the sewer, which may or may not be related to this individual.

Teeth: Visible Missing, Teeth were stained, which suggests he may have been a smoker,  his upper central incisors were also missing
Fractured/Broken Bones: Left Hip, recent fracture of left hip

Case reference: 2006006699.CaseDesc: Eric Larsfolk and John McCormick were last seen playing at the McCormick farm in Caledon. They have not been seen since.

Case reference: 2014004460.CaseDesc: Tsuguo Moroto left his place of business in Banff and rented a car on July 21, 1985. Several days later the vehicle was located at Panther Falls on Highway 93 North near Lake Louise, Alberta.  Several ground, aerial and waterway searches were conducted without success. Mr. Moroto was never located.

Case reference: 2014004403.CaseDesc: Ramona Shular was last seen in Fort St John, British Columbia at the end of November 2003.

Mark: Mole in front of left ear
Scar: Right Eye, Scar from right eyebrow to cheek bone
Tattoo: Right Ankle, Red heart and rose

Case reference: 2014001366.CaseDesc: On April 19, 1995, Paul-Henri Hardy was seen for the last time in the St-Romuald sector of Lévis, Quebec. Paul-Henry was 28 years old at the time of his disappearance.

Case reference: 2006007499.CaseDesc: David Goetz and Lucas Zenger were last seen on August 23, 1992, in the Owen Sound area. They went for a canoe ride.  They travelled down the shoreline along Kepple Township, towards Big Bay. The canoe was located approximately 1.5 miles off Cape Commodore.

Case reference: 2014001642.CaseDesc: In October of 1983, Edna Smith, 24 years old, was last seen at a camp with two other persons on East Trout Lake located approximately 120 kilometers north of Prince Albert, SK. A search party located the bodies of the two companions, however, she has never been located. A boat the trio had previously used was found capsized in the lake and it was suspected that all three individuals drowned.

Deformity: Mouth, Cleft Palate had been operated on

Case reference: 2018059815.CaseDesc: Leroy Custer was last seen in Prince Albert, Saskatchewan, on August 30, 2018.

Case reference: 2013000132.CaseDesc: On March 8, 2008 Trevor Warkentin left the Pyschiatric Ward at the MSA Hospital in Abbotsford BC. A hospital staff worker believes seeing Trevor get into a red pick up truck, but no license plate was obtained.

Teeth: Good, Large gap between front teeth

Case reference: 2014001102.CaseDesc: On March 4, 1973, the remains of a young adult man were recovered from the Burrard Inlet in Vancouver, British Columbia. He carried a Canada flag pocket knife and is believed to have been in the water for several months prior to the discovery.

Case reference: 2014005826.CaseDesc: On June 4, 2012, the Banff RCMP were contacted by a tour company to report that Duc Dao and his son, Nguyen Dao of Vietnam did not arrive to board their bus at the scheduled time.  The two men had been staying at the Banff International Hotel and there were no personal items left in their room. The two men were due to fly back to Vietnam two days later. However, they did not board their scheduled flight and it is unknown if they returned to Vietnam.

Case reference: 2014029389.CaseDesc: Jed Ouillette was last seen on the afternoon of September 8, 2014. Personal identification items were left behind at his residence. Mr. Ouillette had lost his driver's license due to medical issues involving seizures and was in financial difficulty.

Case reference: 2017029343.CaseDesc: On May 13, 2017, Patrick Wall was last seen at his home in Wetaskiwin County, Alberta. His abandoned vehicle was located in Edmonton, also in Alberta.

Case reference: 2012020001.CaseDesc: Todd Beeching has been missing since mid 2005 although it wasn't reported until May 27, 2011.  He is believed to have been last seen in the Midway, BC area.

Case reference: 2023013736.CaseDesc: On July 13, 2022, Magdalene Oerlemans was seen for the last time in Edmonton, Alberta. At the time of her disappearance, Magdalene was leading a high-risk lifestyle.

Case reference: 2014014065.CaseDesc: Ali Rizvi was last seen by his sister at a residence in Saskatoon, Saskatchewan, on June 19th, 2014.

Case reference: 2014002495.CaseDesc: Linda Scott was reported missing to the Edmonton Police Service in April 2000. Linda was last heard from by a family member in March 2000. She is normally in contact with family at least once a week. Linda was believed to be last seen with friends.

Case reference: 2014003393.CaseDesc: James Siwy's last confirmed contact with his family was in 1982 in the Drumheller, Alberta area.  Shortly after that, he left Alberta for Ontario with some friends.  They were traveling in Mr. Siwy's 1975 white Dodge 4 door Monaco that had a burgundy roof.  His family never heard from him again.  In 1984 Mr. Siwy's Monaco was found abandoned in Ontario and there were unconfirmed reports that he may have been hitchhiking in northern Ontario.  Mr. Siwy was reported missing by his family in 1994 when they tried to notify him of the death of a family member.

Hair: Brown, Wavy, Long, parted in the middle

Case reference: 2022040012.CaseDesc: On August 10, 2022, Joseph Aldonia Chiasson was seen for the last time by his loved ones in the Shippagan region in New Brunswick. There have been unconfirmed reports he was seen in the Lamèque, NB area on August 12, 2022.

Deformity: Right Leg, Limps on Right leg

Case reference: 2014006556.CaseDesc: On the 23rd of July, 2006, Preston Waldner was swimming at Paradise Beach, South Saskatchewan River, when he and another fellow were attempting to swim across the river. The boys got part way across when they ran into trouble due to the very strong current of the river. The one fellow was pulled from the river and survived, however Preston was seen going under and he never resurfaced. A search was conducted but he has not been located.

Tattoo: Left Chest, Howling wolf with the initial "PWW" above the wolf

Case reference: 2018013207.CaseDesc: On the morning of March 12, 2018, Ariel Kouakou left his home, on foot, to go to a friend’s house. At around 11:15 am, a witness walking a dog saw Ariel on the bicycle path in Park of la Merci located between Gouin Boulevard and the Rivière des Prairies.

Case reference: 2014005212.CaseDesc: Terry Rowe was involved in a boating accident on Lake Simcoe in Ontario on May 14, 1977. He is believed to have drowned.

Case reference: 2020010925.CaseDesc: On October 2, 1990, Mabel Wong was seen for the last time, at approximately 10:30pm, as she left her residence in Toronto, Ontario. It is believed that Mabel left her home to go meet someone. Her vehicle was found approximately two kilometers from her home.

Shoes: Leather, Black, CASUAL, with metal tips

Case reference: 2020004223.CaseDesc: On December 24, 2019, Ryan Docherty was seen for the last time by his family in London, Ontario. The last known contact between Ryan and his friends was during the last week of December. On March 6, 2020, his mother reported him missing after returning from an extended trip, and noticing that Ryan had not shown up at her residence to retrieve some cheques.

Scar: Right Hand, 3 inches on the top
Tattoo: Upper Back, Words: "EAZY-E"; gun and bullet
Left Hand, A heart with the name "Jodi"
Left Wrist, 6 eyes inside a triangle
Chest, Doc and Pennywise the clown

Case reference: 2014005326.CaseDesc: On June 2, 1972, Edmonton Police Service members found a purse and identification belonging to Eunice Antoniuk on the walkway of the High Level Bridge in Edmonton, Alberta. A note addressed to her family was found within the purse. All police searches were negative and Eunice has not been seen since.

Case reference: 2014001428.CaseDesc: On May 19, 1998, at approximately 7:00 p.m., Rémi Engrand left a residence for men in Valleyfield, Quebec, for a walk with two other residents of the center where he had been staying for a few days. They went to the Delpha-Sauvé Park, where Rémi wanted to go swimming in the river, near the waterfall. The three separated, leaving Rémi alone and when they returned, they found Rémi’s clothes on the shoreline. The current in this section of the river is very fast and the presence of the falls makes swimming very risky. Rémi has not been seen since this time.

Case reference: 2020008538.CaseDesc: In mid-June 1976, Peter Vollar was last seen by his landlord in Toronto, Ontario. Peter had advised he was heading to London, Ontario for two weeks to seek job opportunities. All of his personal belongings were left behind.

Case reference: 2014004904.CaseDesc: On the evening of April 5, 2007, Woon-Young Lee was seen for the last time at the West Park Health Centre in Toronto, Ontario.  When nurses came to Woon-Young's room the next day, she was gone.

Case reference: 2016061850.CaseDesc: On February 20, 1978, the body of a male was found in the snow on the east side of the Bayview Extension, near the east end of Labatt Ave, on the west bank of the Don River. His post-mortem weight was recorded as being 158lbs, however, this measurement may not represent his actual living weight due to post-mortem changes noted at autopsy. His appendix was present.

Hair: Brown, Grey, Unshaven, beard and moustache
Coat: Dark grey winter coat with a checkered pattern
Pyjama: Blue, White, Blue and white patterned pyjama bottoms
Scarf: Black, blue and red plaid scarf
Shirt: Maroon, Black, Maroon and black sport shirt
Mark: Left Hip, Numerous small fairly recent abrasions
Left Arm, Number of unswollen red-brown, circular contusions
Right Arm, Number of unswollen red-brown, circular contusions
Left Abdomen, Numerous small fairly recent abrasions
Right Leg, Numerous small fairly recent abrasions
Left Thigh, Numerous small fairly recent abrasions
3 scabbed abrasions around the left eye orbit.
Scar: Numerous small, old, healed, circular scars on a forearm
Abdomen, Numerous small, old, healed, circular scars
Shoulders, Numerous small, old, healed, circular scars

Case reference: 2012020121.CaseDesc: Mathieu Beauregard Messier was alone at home with his wife. At approximately 7:00 p.m., Mathieu told his wife he had to go see a friend and that he would be back later in the evening. He left alone in his wife’s vehicle and with her cellphone. At approximately 10:30 p.m., police received a call that a vehicle was on fire on Rang du Haut-de-la-Rivière, near the military base in Farnham, Quebec. The vehicle was identified as that of Mathieu’s wife. There was nobody inside the vehicle, and Mathieu has not been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2014004947.CaseDesc: On June 1, 2007, Ralph Hopper was seen for the last time as he was leaving the l'Aboiteau residence, a special care home where he lived in Dieppe, New Brunswick. Ralph is mentally challenged, diabetic and requires prescription medication.

Case reference: 2017073542.CaseDesc: On November 4, 2016, an unidentified man was discovered in Lake Ontario in St. Catharines, Ontario. Biogeographic ancestry testing predicts he was of East Asian Ancestry.

Case reference: 2020009327.CaseDesc: On April 1, 2020, James Garnett was seen for the last time at approximately 9:25 pm when he was exiting a bus onto Douglas Avenue near the Reversing Falls Bridge located in Saint John, New Brunswick.

Hat: Blue, White, Toque, Has white snowflakes

Case reference: 2014003272.CaseDesc: On December 30, 1967 Michael Smith left his North Vancouver residence. Mr. Smith had been despondent over a friend’s death and has not been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2014003001.CaseDesc: Mr. Westbrook was last seen during the late afternoon/early evening hours on September 8, 1994. Mr. Westbrook had stopped at the Highwayman Restaurant located at 3001 Highway 11 North to gas up a motor home as he was attempting to return to Strathroy, Ontario. Family members had followed him in their vehicle and took away his keys to prevent him from driving any further as they were concerned about his driving. After a confrontation with his family members he was last seen walking southbound on Highway 11 in an agitated state. He was observed walking and hitchhiking heading towards the city of North Bay, ON. He has not been seen since.

Case reference: 2014003615.CaseDesc: On September 26th, 1970, Mr. Claus and his friend were reported missing to police as they were overdue by boat. A pilot later spotted a swamped boat on Cormorant Lake, Manitoba and advised police. Despite patrols and dragging operations Mr. Claus was never located. His partner was later found and the cause of death determined to be drowning. No foul play is suspected in this matter.

Case reference: 2013000023.CaseDesc: Marilyn Ann Hersey was last seen on January 28, 2006, outside the Abbie J. Lane Memorial Building on Veterans Memorial Lane in Halifax, Nova Scotia.  Marilyn was due to return to the hospital but never did and was not seen again.  Marilyn needs to take daily medications to treat numerous ailments which she did not take with her after leaving the hospital.

Hair: Blonde, Grey, Wavy blonde and greying hair

Case reference: 2014001046.CaseDesc: On July 23, 1990, the body of this middle-aged man was found on Gore Avenue in Vancouver, British Columbia. He died of complications related to chronic alcohol dependence.

Hair: Blonde, Long dark blonde hair with greying beard
Jacket: Denim, Blue, Young Life Creator brand
Shoes: Grey, Nike Air brand, running shoes

Case reference: 2013000015.CaseDesc: On November 6, 1968, Robert Lessard went onto the Ottawa River in a boat, travelling to a hunting camp. He never arrived and the boat was located on the river.

Case reference: 2018063450.CaseDesc: On July 30, 2003, at approximately 8:30am, William King was seen for the last time when he left his seniors residence in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2014005683.CaseDesc: Lorie MacDougall was last seen on October 11, 2011, leaving her residence in St.Catherines, Ontario.  Shortly after this, Lorie’s vehicle was located abandoned in a parking lot near Niagara Glen Centre in Niagara Falls, Ontario.  At this time Lorie was feeling despondent.

Case reference: 2009000199.CaseDesc: On October 17, 1996, Alf Joergensen left his residence to go on a business trip to London, England. Mr. Joergensen told his wife he would be returning on either October 22nd or 23rd. He indicated he was meeting a business associate in London, however it was later confirmed there were no scheduled  business meetings with this particular individual, who hadn't seen Mr. Joergensen since the previous year. Mr. Joergensen flew to England on October 17, 1996 and was confirmed to have flown into Toronto airport on October 19, 1996, via British Airways. He has not been seen nor heard from since this date and his family and police are concerned for his safety and well-being.

Teeth: Visible Missing, Rear teeth both sides of upper jaw missing.  Dental records available.

Case reference: 2014019687.CaseDesc: On November 23, 2013, an unidentified partial male skull was found in a forested area along a power line in Anmore near Coquitlam, BC. The decedent has likely been missing for several years.

Deformity: Head, Fractured facial bones. Underwent surgery to his skull, possibly during the 1980s or 1990s

Case reference: 2014004404.CaseDesc: On September 12, 1993, Sidiki Camara was reported missing by air traffic control after disappearing from the radar while flying to Prince Edward Island from the Moncton Airport. Sidiki's plane was last recorded descending at a high rate of speed. Only a few parts of the plane were found during a search of the crash location.

Case reference: 2018042433.CaseDesc: On July 28, 2018, Vesta Rosta was last seen leaving a Children Aid Society home in Brampton, Ontario. There is reason to believe that Vesta may be in the state of Maryland in the United States of America or in Romania with her parents, Pardelian Rosta and Bacrii Rostas.

Shirt: Black, Red, T-shirt, black with red writing

Case reference: 2005006599.CaseDesc:
On September 18, 1978, the body of an unidentified man was found in the Toronto Harbour of Lake Ontario. His post-mortem weight was 163lbs and his length was measured at 5'10", however, these measurements may not represent his actual living weight and height due to post-mortem changes noted at autopsy.
Staining on his teeth suggest that he may have been a smoker. It is estimated that he had been in the water for several weeks.

Teeth: Stained, Overbite & several amalgam fillings. Several teeth lost/extracted during life; lower right lateral incisor being most obvious.

Case reference: 2014005491.CaseDesc: On August 9, 2010, Michael Blakney was seen for the last time on a forest trail in the Scoudouc area of New Brunswick.

Deformity: Left Leg, Walks with a limp

Case reference: 2016041364.CaseDesc: Tony Olekas was last seen on July 21, 2016 when he was mushroom picking at Big Sandy Lake, Sasketchewan.
